title: Libertarian Party of Maine
added: On December 11, 2020, the party's declaration of intent to form a recognized party was recognized by the State of Maine.<ref>https://www.lp.org/maine-lp-files-declaration-of-intent-to-form-a-recognized-party/<ref> To become a qualifying party and participate in primary elections, the party must have 5,000 registered voters by January 2, 2022. In order to maintain this status, the party must have 10,000 registered voters cast ballots in the November 2022 state election.

On December 14, 2020, Maine State Representative, John Andrews of House District 73, announced his intent to leave the Republican party and enroll as a Libertarian,<ref>https://www.lp.org/maine-state-rep-john-andrews-joins-the-libertarian-party/<ref> becoming Maine's first Libertarian state legislator.

title: Libertarian Party of Maine
added: On December 11, 2020, the party's declaration of intent to form a recognized party was recognized by the State of Maine.<ref>https://www.lp.org/maine-lp-files-declaration-of-intent-to-form-a-recognized-party/</ref> To become a qualifying party and participate in primary elections, the party must have 5,000 registered voters by January 2, 2022. In order to maintain this status, the party must have 10,000 registered voters cast ballots in the November 2022 state election.

On December 14, 2020, Maine State Representative, John Andrews of House District 73, announced his intent to leave the Republican party and enroll as a Libertarian,<ref>https://www.lp.org/maine-state-rep-john-andrews-joins-the-libertarian-party/</ref> becoming Maine's first Libertarian state legislator.
